Sick children need treatment quickly. Begin treatment before the child leaves, if the child can drink.
keep ORS solution in a clean, covered container
do not keep the mixed ORS solution for more than 24 hours
giving zinc for the full 10 days

To confirm that the test is NEGATIVE, be sure to wait the full 15 minutes after adding the buffer.

actions.id: Do a rapid diagnostic test (RDT) for malaria

reasons: If RDT is positive, give oral antimalarial AL (Artemether-Lumefantrine)

actions.id: Give Artemether-Lumefantrine 1 tablet twice daily for 3 days (total 6 tablets); Help caregiver to give first dose now

reasons: If RDT is positive, give oral antimalarial AL (Artemether-Lumefantrine)

actions.id: Give Artemether-Lumefantrine 2 tablet twice daily for 3 days (total 12 tablets); Help caregiver to give first dose now

reasons: Do not use an antimalarial that has expired

actions.id: check the expiration date on the package
give first dose now: 2 tablets of AL
advise second dose after 8 hours: 2 tablets of AL
on day 2: 2 tablets of AL in the morning and 2 tablets at night
on day 3: 2 tablets of AL in the morning and 2 tablets at night
wash hands with soap and water
crush the tablet with a spoon in a cup or small bowl
mix with breast milk or with water or crush with banana or another favourite food of the child
give the whole dose with a spoon

reasons: cough with fast breathing is a sign of pneumonia
Child with fever and positive RDT result for malaria

actions.id: Give oral antibiotic (amoxicillin tablet - 250mg) twice daily for 5 days; Age 2 months up to 12 months - 1 tablet (total 10 tablets); Help caregiver to give first dose now.
Ask the caregiver to give the first dose immediately. Help the caregiver crush the amoxicillin tablet and add water or breast milk to it to make it easier for the child to take.
Then tell the caregiver to continue giving the dose morning and evening until the tablets are finished (for 5 days). Mark the dose on the package.
Ask the caregiver to repeat the instructions before leaving with the child.
Give oral antibiotic (amoxicillin tablet - 250mg) twice daily for 5 days; Age 12 months up to 5 years - 2 tablet (total 20 tablets); Help caregiver to give first dose now.
Ask the caregiver to give the first dose immediately. Help the caregiver crush the amoxicillin tablet and add water or breast milk to it to make it easier for the child to take.
Then tell the caregiver to continue giving the dose morning and evening until the tablets are finished (for 5 days). Mark the dose on the package.
Ask the caregiver to repeat the instructions before leaving with the child.

reasons: Do not give medicine to a child who does not need it.
For ALL children treated at home: advise on home care
Breastfeed more frequently during illness including diarrhoea
Give only breast milk and medicines recommended by your doctor/ health care provider
If your baby refuses to breastfeed, encourage your baby until he or she takes the breast again
If the baby is too weak to suckle, express breast milk to give the baby
When you are sick, you can continue to breastfeed your baby
For children who are not exclusively breastfed, give clean water and more fluid foods
The child with diarrhoea should also take ORS solution
12-week-old child due for 10-week vaccines not yet received
2 and a half years old with no vaccines received
If the family cannot bring the child to see you, it is important to find a way to see the child

Do a rapid diagnostic test (RDT) for malaria

If RDT is positive, give oral antimalarial AL (Artemether-Lumefantrine) - 1 tablet twice daily for 3 days (total 6 tablets). Help caregiver to give first dose now. Advise to give 2nd dose after 8 hours and to give dose twice daily for 2 more days.

If RDT is positive, give oral antimalarial AL (Artemether-Lumefantrine) - 2 tablet twice daily for 3 days (total 12 tablets). Help caregiver to give first dose now. Advise to give 2nd dose after 8 hours and to give dose twice daily for 2 more days.
Give oral antibiotic (amoxicillin tablet - 250mg) - 1 tablet twice daily for 5 days (total 10 tablets). Help caregiver to give first dose now.
Give oral antibiotic (amoxicillin tablet - 250mg) - 2 tablet twice daily for 5 days (total 20 tablets). Help caregiver to give first dose now.
Go to nearest health facility immediately
return to CHW if not possible

Give oral antibiotic (amoxicillin tablet - 250mg) Age 2 months up to 12 months - 1 tablet (total 10 tablets) Give twice daily for 5 days
Help caregiver to give first dose now
Give oral antibiotic (amoxicillin tablet - 250mg) Age 12 months up to 5 y ears - 2 tablet (total 20 tablets) Give twice daily for 5 days
Help caregiver to give first dose now
refer the child to a supplementary feeding programme, if available

reasons: For ALL children treated at home, advise on home care

actions.id: Advise caregiver to give more fluids and continue feeding.
Advise on when to return. Go to nearest health facility immediately, or if not possible, return to CHW if child: Cannot drink or feed; Becomes sicker; Has blood in the stool
Advise caregiver on sleeping under a bednet (ITN)
Follow up child in 3 days (schedule appointment in item 6 below)

reasons: Arrange transportation, and help solve other difficulties in referral.

actions.id: Arrange transportation, and help solve other difficulties in referral.
FOLLOW UP child on return at least once a week until child is well.

reasons: OTHER PROBLEM or condition you cannot treat

canonical_map.not able to drink or feed anything: not able to drink or feed anything
canonical_map.not able to feed anything: not able to drink or feed anything
canonical_map.not able to drink: not able to drink or feed anything
